pr_title: CB-6329: Add recovery of the FreeIPA primary gateway

timeline.message:
CB-6329: Add recovery of the FreeIPA primary gateway

Allow the FreeIPA primary gateway to be recovered.

When recovering the primary gateway, the primary gateway is switched
to a working instance. Then the old primary gateway is removed by
downscaling. A new FreeIPA master is created during upscale. Then the
primary gateway is switched back to the FreeIPA master.

The unused FreeIPA core instance metadata type was removed.

This was tested using the unit tests and it was manually tested using
a local instance of cloudbreak.

timeline.bodyText:
some nits:

maybe select instead of get would be better
instanceIdsToAvoid got me confused as I had to lookup the whole call chain to figure it out. Maybe we should rename this to something like instancesToRepair, as this is the reason we would like to avoid them if I'm not mistaken
this method got a little big. could you refactor out some bits into separate method, like  finding  Optional<String> freeIpaMasterInstanceId with stream
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: maybe logs some would be nice here just to see which branch is selected and which IDs are chosen
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: why do we have to call salt to find this out? shouldn't be this info available on java side?
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText:
In a normal situation, the FreeIPA primary gateway is the FreeIPA master. The primary gateway is stored in the FreeIPA database. During a repair of the primary gateway or after a failed repair of the primary gateway, it is likely that the FreeIPA primary gateway is a different node. As far as I can tell, FreeIPA doesn't store the salt roles in the database. I need to ensure that only a single node is identified as the primary FreeIPA instance (if multiple instances generate the CRLs it will be a problem), so I am querying FreeIPA.
If we add the FreeIPA roles into the database, this will be one more thing to synchronize and it will only be used during repair anyway.
replies.author: jamisonbennett

timeline.bodyText: this method got really big, could you refactor to smaller bits
timeline.author: lacikaaa

CB-6329: Add recovery of the FreeIPA primary gateway

Allow the FreeIPA primary gateway to be recovered.

When recovering the primary gateway, the primary gateway is switched
to a working instance. Then the old primary gateway is removed by
downscaling. A new FreeIPA master is created during upscale. Then the
primary gateway is switched back to the FreeIPA master.

The unused FreeIPA core instance metadata type was removed.

This was tested using the unit tests, integration tests, and it was
manually tested using a local instance of cloudbreak.

timeline.bodyText:
so I'm just dropping it here, but I noticed somewhere else also. We used everywhere FreeIpa until now (at least I hope so), and not FreeIPA. Could you rename methods, classes to match this?
of course FreeIPA in logs and messages is fine
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I fixed this one....but I will put the others in a separate PR. There are quite a few capitalization changes (19 files and their associated classes).
replies.author: jamisonbennett
